CoCreateInstance.description: Creates a single uninitialized object of the class associated with a specified CLSID.

CoCreateInstanceEx.description: Creates an instance of a specific class on a specific computer.

CoGetClassObject.description: Provides a pointer to an interface on a class object associated with a specified CLSID. CoGetClassObject locates, and if necessary, dynamically loads the executable code required to do this.

CoInitializeEx.description: Initializes the COM library for use by the calling thread, sets the thread's concurrency model, and creates a new apartment for the thread if one is required.

CoInitializeSecurity.description: Registers security and sets the default security values for the process.

CoUninitialize.description: Closes the COM library on the current thread, unloads all DLLs loaded by the thread, frees any other resources that the thread maintains, and forces all RPC connections on the thread to close.

CreateActCtxW.description: The CreateActCtx function creates an activation context.

NtDeviceIoControlFile.description: The HttpCreateUrlGroup function creates a URL Group  under the specified  server session.

OleInitialize.description: Initializes the COM library on the current apartment, identifies the concurrency model as single-thread apartment (STA), and enables additional functionality described in the Remarks section below. Applications must initialize the COM library before they can call COM library functions other than CoGetMalloc and memory allocation functions.

WSAStartup.description: The WSAStartup function initiates use of the Winsock DLL by a process.

closesocket.description: The closesocket function closes an existing socket.

sendto.description: The sendto function sends data to a specific destination.

shutdown.description: The shutdown function disables sends or receives on a socket.

socket.description: The socket function creates a socket that is bound to a specific transport service provider.

FindWindowExW.description: Retrieves a handle to a window whose class name and window name match the specified strings. The function searches child windows, beginning with the one following the specified child window. This function does not perform a case-sensitive search.

FindWindowW.description: Retrieves a handle to the top-level window whose class name and window name match the specified strings. This function does not search child windows. This function does not perform a case-sensitive search.

GetComputerNameA.description: Retrieves the NetBIOS name of the local computer. This name is established at system startup, when the system reads it from the registry.

GetCursorPos.description: Retrieves the position of the mouse cursor, in screen coordinates.

GetDiskFreeSpaceExW.description: Retrieves information about the amount of space that is available on a disk volume, which is the total     amount of space, the total amount of free space, and the total amount of free space available to the user that is     associated with the calling thread.

GetForegroundWindow.description: Retrieves a handle to the foreground window (the window with which the user is currently working). The system assigns a slightly higher priority to the thread that creates the foreground window than it does to other threads.

GetKeyState.description: Retrieves the status of the specified virtual key. The status specifies whether the key is up, down, or toggled (on, off—alternating each time the key is pressed).

GetNativeSystemInfo.description: Retrieves information about the current system to an application running under WOW64. If the function is called from a 64-bit application, it is equivalent to the GetSystemInfo function.

GetSystemDirectoryA.description: Retrieves the path of the system directory. The system directory contains system files such as dynamic-link libraries and drivers.

GetSystemDirectoryW.description: Retrieves the path of the system directory. The system directory contains system files such as dynamic-link libraries and drivers.

GetSystemInfo.description: Retrieves information about the current system.

GetSystemMetrics.description: Retrieves the specified     system metric or system configuration setting.

GetSystemTimeAsFileTime.description: Retrieves the current system date and time. The information is in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) format.

GetSystemWindowsDirectoryW.description: Retrieves the path of the shared Windows directory on a multi-user system.

GetTimeZoneInformation.description: Retrieves the current time zone settings. These settings control the translations between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and local time.

GetUserNameExW.description: Retrieves the name of the user or other security principal associated with the calling thread. You can specify the format of the returned name.

GlobalMemoryStatusEx.description: Retrieves information about the system's current usage of both physical and virtual memory.

LookupAccountSidW.description: The LookupAccountSid function accepts a security identifier (SID) as input. It retrieves the name of the account for this SID and the name of the first domain on which this SID is found.

LookupPrivilegeValueW.description: Creates the specified registry key. If the key already exists, the function opens it. Note that key names are not case sensitive.

NtCreateMutant.description: Creates or opens a named or unnamed event object.

NtDelayExecution.description: Suspends the current thread until the specified condition is met. Execution resumes when one of the following occurs:

NtQuerySystemInformation.description: [NtQuerySystemInformation may be altered or unavailable in future versions of Windows. Applications should use the alternate functions listed in this topic.]

NtResumeThread.description: Decrements a thread's suspend count. When the suspend count is decremented to zero, the execution of the thread is resumed.

RegQueryInfoKeyA.description: Retrieves information about the specified registry key.

RegQueryInfoKeyW.description: Retrieves information about the specified registry key.

SetErrorMode.description: Controls whether the system will handle the specified types of serious errors or whether the process will handle them.

FindFirstFileExW.description: Searches a directory for a file or subdirectory with a name and attributes that match those     specified.

GetFileAttributesExW.description: Retrieves attributes for a specified file or directory.

GetFileAttributesW.description: Retrieves file system attributes for a specified file or directory.

GetFileSize.description: Retrieves the size of the specified file, in bytes.

GetFileSizeEx.description: Retrieves the size of the specified file.

GetFileType.description: Retrieves the file type of the specified file.

GetFileVersionInfoSizeW.description: Determines whether the operating system can retrieve version information for a specified file. If version information is available, GetFileVersionInfoSize returns the size, in bytes, of that information.

GetFileVersionInfoW.description: Retrieves version information for the specified file.

GetVolumeNameForVolumeMountPointW.description: Retrieves a volume GUID path for the volume that is associated with the specified volume mount point (    drive letter, volume GUID path, or mounted folder).

GetVolumePathNamesForVolumeNameW.description: Retrieves a list of drive letters and mounted folder paths for the specified volume.

LoadResource.description: Retrieves a handle that can be used to obtain a pointer to the first byte of the specified resource in memory.

NtCreateFile.description: Creates or opens a file or I/O device. The most commonly used I/O devices are as follows: file, file     stream, directory, physical disk, volume, console buffer, tape drive, communications resource, mailslot, and     pipe. The function returns a handle that can be used to access the file or device for various types of     I/O depending on the file or device and the flags and attributes specified.

NtCreateSection.description: Creates or opens a named or unnamed file mapping object for a specified file.

NtOpenFile.description: Creates, opens, reopens, or deletes a file.

NtQueryDirectoryFile.description: The ZwQueryDirectoryFile routine returns various kinds of information about files in the directory specified by a given file handle.

NtQueryInformationFile.description: [NtQueryInformationProcess may be altered or unavailable in future versions of Windows. Applications should use the alternate functions listed in this topic.]

NtReadFile.description: Reads data from the specified file or input/output (I/O) device. Reads occur at the position specified     by the file pointer if supported by the device.

SHGetFolderPathW.description: Deprecated. Gets the path of a folder identified by a CSIDL value.

OpenSCManagerW.description: Establishes a connection to the service control manager on the specified computer and opens the specified service control manager database.

CreateDirectoryW.description: Creates a new directory. If the underlying file system supports security on files and     directories, the function applies a specified security descriptor to the new directory.

CryptAcquireContextW.description: The CryptAcquireContext function is used to acquire a handle to a particular key container within a particular cryptographic service provider (CSP). This returned handle is used in calls to CryptoAPI functions that use the selected CSP.

CryptCreateHash.description: The CryptCreateHash function initiates the hashing of a stream of data. It creates and returns to the calling application a handle to a cryptographic service provider (CSP) hash object. This handle is used in subsequent calls to CryptHashData and CryptHashSessionKey to hash session keys and other streams of data.

CryptDecodeObjectEx.description: The CryptDecodeObjectEx function decodes a structure of the type indicated by the lpszStructType parameter. CryptDecodeObjectEx offers a significant performance improvement over CryptDecodeObject by supporting memory allocation with the CRYPT_DECODE_ALLOC_FLAG value.

CryptEncrypt.description: The CryptEncrypt function encrypts data. The algorithm used to encrypt the data is designated by the key held by the CSP module and is referenced by the hKey parameter.

CryptHashData.description: The CryptHashData function adds data to a specified hash object. This function and CryptHashSessionKey can be called multiple times to compute the hash of long or discontinuous data streams.

GetFileInformationByHandle.description: Retrieves file information for the specified file.

GetFileInformationByHandleEx.description: Retrieves file information for the specified file.

GetTempPathW.description: Retrieves the path of the directory designated for temporary files.

MoveFileWithProgressW.description: Moves a file or directory, including its children. You can provide a callback function that receives     progress notifications.

NtSetInformationFile.description: The ZwSetInformationFile routine changes various kinds of information about a file object.

SetFileAttributesW.description: Sets the attributes for a file or directory.

NtTerminateProcess.description: Terminates the specified process and all of its threads.

SetFilePointer.description: Moves the file pointer of the specified file.

SetFilePointerEx.description: Moves the file pointer of the specified file.

DrawTextExW.description: The DrawTextEx function draws formatted text in the specified rectangle.

LoadStringW.description: Loads a string resource from the executable file associated with a specified module, copies the string into a buffer, and appends a terminating null character.

NtWriteFile.description: Writes data to the specified file or input/output (I/O) device.

SendNotifyMessageW.description: Sends the specified message to a window or windows. If the window was created by the calling thread, SendNotifyMessage calls the window procedure for the window and does not return until the window procedure has processed the message. If the window was created by a different thread, SendNotifyMessage passes the message to the window procedure and returns immediately; it does not wait for the window procedure to finish processing the message.

WriteConsoleA.description: Writes a character string to a console screen buffer beginning at the current cursor location.
